text:
A man sat before a pot of beer. 

His companion, stout and grey-bearded, slept on the bench. 

The drunkard stirred, cracking his fingers. 

He hummed a meaningless refrain. 

“His wife a year he fondly loved…” 

He drifted back to sleep. 

Suddenly awake, he sang, “Walking along the crowded row…” 

His silent companion glared with distrust. 

In the corner, a retired clerk sipped his drink. 

He watched the scene unfold, anxious and alone.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov observes a drunken man in a tavern, highlighting the contrasting reactions of the patrons to his antics.
